intro: Johanneshowellia, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear yellowish to reddish flowers. Johanneshowellia typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is often found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
